}} 'Ernst Cassirer' (; July 28, 1874 – April 13, 1945) was a German
philosopher. Trained within the Neo-Kantian Marburg School, he initially
followed his mentor Hermann Cohen in attempting to supply an idealistic
philosophy of science; after Cohen's death, he developed a theory of
symbolism, and used it to expand phenomenology of knowledge into a more
general philosophy of culture. He is one of the leading 20th century advocates
of philosophical idealism.
